snippet: More than 5 million cannot afford food, and another 5 million are on the edge as political instability has compounded a surge in global food and fuel prices.
abstract: Political instability and a surge in global food and fuel prices have given Yemen the world’s third-highest rate of child malnutrition; 22 percent of population, or five million people, cannot produce or buy enough to feed themselves.
lead_paragraph: More than 5 million cannot afford food, and another 5 million are on the edge as political instability has compounded a surge in global food and fuel prices.

headline.seo: Yemen in Crisis as Global Food Prices Rise
headline.main: Millions Are Facing Food Crisis in Yemen, U.N. Agency Says
headline.print_headline: Millions Are Facing Food Crisis in Yemen as Global Prices Rise, U.N. Agency Says
